Article Title: Raising Financially Savvy Kids: Age-Appropriate Money Management Education for the Next Generation
Article Text:
By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults.

By Tvisha Tuli, Content Creator

Start Early with a Modest Allowance: Consider providing your children with a small monthly allowance that introduces them to the concept of budgeting and the value of earning money through contributing to household chores. Make Saving a Game: Start small, perhaps with a reward system tied to their favorite pastimes. By linking their efforts to tangible rewards, such as completing chores to play video games, the habit of budgeting gets cultivated and seamlessly transitions into saving real money. Teach Budgeting Using the 50:30:20 Rule: This is a simple yet powerful tool that teaches them to allocate 50% of their money for needs, like food and clothing, 30% for wants, such as toys or treats, and 20% for savings . This approach helps children discern between needs and wants while cultivating patience in their financial journey. Make Learning Fun with Board Games: Incorporate board games like Monopoly, Game of Life, etc., into family game nights. These games not only entertain but also impart valuable lessons on financial planning, decision-making, and the significance of saving and investing. Explore Age-Appropriate Books: Invest in age-appropriate books that emphasize the importance of saving and financial responsibility, from colorful stories for younger audiences to more sophisticated guides for older children. Encourage Smart Shopping : Take children along when shopping and show them how to compare prices. Teach them to look for good deals and bargains, instilling resourcefulness and a strong sense of stewardship.

If the world is a giant machine, money is the fuel that keeps it running smoothly. From buying groceries to raising funds, money is at the heart of almost everything we do. That's why understanding how money works is so crucial in today's world.However, in the schoolyard of life, the curriculum often skips over the ABCs of financial literacy .Hence, it becomes imperative for parents to step into the role of headmasters, ensuring their children are equipped with more than just algebra and history. Just as parents meticulously prepare their children for exams and extracurricular activities, they must also take the reins in imparting essential lessons on money management . When one knows how to budget, save, and spend wisely, one is better prepared to handle everyday situations like paying bills, or even planning for big goals like college or a career.Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest; it's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. From an early age, children absorb lessons about money, whether consciously or unconsciously, from their surroundings. Therefore, it's incumbent upon parents, educators, and policymakers to ensure that these lessons are deliberate and conducive to financial well-being. Just as we teach children the alphabet before they can read, we should introduce basic financial concepts before they encounter their first paycheck.Here are practical steps that parents can incorporate into their child-rearing journey to ensure a lifetime of sound financial habits:By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults, capable of making informed decisions, pursuing their dreams, and contributing meaningfully to society. As these empowered individuals enter the workforce and engage in economic activities, they will not only secure their financial well-being but cultivate a stronger, more resilient economy for generations to come.
Article Summary: Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest. It's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults.

Key components of hallmark on gold jewellery



Gold, silver hallmarking : Gold and silver jewllery have long been treasured for their beauty and value. However, ensuring their purity and authenticity is important, especially in a market prone to fraudulent practices. This is where the hallmarking scheme comes into play. Here‚Äôs what you need to know about hallmarking charges and its procedures:Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver.It serves as a guarantee of their purity or fineness. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820, according to an ET report.Hallmarking charges are applied per article, regardless of its weight. For gold articles, the charge is Rs 45 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 200 for a consignment. Similarly, for silver articles, the charge is Rs 35 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 150 for a consignment. It's important to note that additional taxes and levies may apply.A consignment refers to a collection of articles with the same fineness, from which a sample is drawn and assayed for compliance. Different lots may exist within a consignment.Anyone can have their hallmarked jewellery tested for purity at an A&H centre by paying a testing fee of Rs. 200 (for testing using the fire assay method as per IS 1418). These centres must be recognized by the BIS. The list of recognized A&H centres is available on the BIS website under the hallmarking section.The primary objective of hallmarking is to safeguard consumers from counterfeit products. To achieve this, the Indian government made hallmarking mandatory for gold jewellery from June 16, 2021. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification ( HUID ) number.If you bought gold jewellery on or before June 30, 2021, it may have old hallmarking signs. These signs include the purity/fineness mark and the BIS emblem, along with two additional indications: the jeweller's identification number and the assay centre's mark/number.However, starting July 1, 2021, these two indications were replaced with a unique alphanumeric HUID code. The hallmark remains valid for the lifetime of the jewellery, and consumers can sell old jewellery, whether hallmarked or un-hallmarked, to jewellers.The HUID, or hallmark Unique Identification number, is a key component of hallmarking in gold jewellery. It's a unique six-digit alphanumeric code assigned to each hallmarked item, allowing for traceability. Customers can verify the HUID number using the 'Verify HUID' feature in the BIS Care App.Since the introduction of the HUID on July 1, 2021, the hallmark on gold jewellery consists of three marks: the BIS logo, the purity of the article in caratage and fineness, and a unique six-digit alphanumeric HUID number.
Article Summary: Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification number.

Article Title: Sony announces new games for PS Plus February collection: Payday 3, High on Life, and Pac-Man World Re-Pac
Article Text: Sony has announced its February PlayStation Plus lineup , featuring Payday 3 , High on Life , and Pac-Man World Re-Pac , available to subscribers from February 4 to March 3.Payday 3, a PS5-exclusive co-op first-person shooter, returns players to the criminal underworld as the infamous Payday Gang emerges from retirement. The updated version includes improved UI, refined gameplay mechanics, and enhanced visuals, along with the classic arcade game as an unlockable bonus.These new titles replace January's offerings of Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League, Need for Speed Hot Pursuit Remastered, and The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe, which will be removed from the service on February 3.PlayStation Plus subscribers can add all three February games to their library starting February 4.
Article Summary: Payday 3 is a PS5-exclusive co-op first-person shooter. High on Life is a comedic sci-fi shooter where players battle an alien cartel. Pac-Man World Re- Pac is a modernized remake of the 2004 platformer.

Article Title: Apple partners Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX to bring Starlink satellite services to iPhones
Article Text:
An Apple store (Image for representation)

Apple has teamed up with Elon Musk's SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into iPhones. This partnership aims to provide reliable satellite communication services, even in areas without cellular coverage.The latest iOS 18.3 update, released this week, includes support for Starlink's satellite network. This feature allows iPhone users to send text messages via satellite, with plans to expand into data and voice services in the future.Unlike Apple's existing satellite service, which requires users to manually align their iPhones with satellites, the Starlink option works automatically, even when the phone is in a pocket.T-Mobile has initiated a limited beta program, inviting select iPhone users to test the Starlink integration. Participants received a message stating, "You‚Äôre in the T-Mobile Starlink beta. You can now stay connected with texting via satellite from virtually anywhere." The beta currently supports iPhone 14 and later models, with plans to expand to more users and eventually other countries.Elon Musk responded to the news on social media, highlighting that the current Starlink technology supports images, music, and podcasts, with future upgrades expected to add video support. This partnership underscores Apple's commitment to enhancing connectivity and providing innovative solutions for its users.
Article Summary: Apple has teamed up with Elon Musk's SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into iPhones. This partnership aims to provide reliable satellite communication services, even in areas without cellular coverage. The beta currently supports iPhone 14 and later models, with plans to expand to more users and eventually other countries.

Article Title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra first impressions: Carrying the legacy
Article Text:
Design

Display

Hardware and software

Camera

What we think

Samsung launched its most expensive Galaxy S-series smartphone ‚Äì Galaxy S25 Ultra at its first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025 in San Jose, US. With its sleek design, powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, and top-tier camera capabilities, the S25 Ultra is designed to impress the consumers. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 1,29,999 and it packs in a lot of features and looks like a compelling buy.We got the chance to spend some time with the new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra and here‚Äôs our first impressions of the new Samsung smartphone.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra has borrowed its design aesthetics from its predecessor. The most expensive S series smartphone from Samsung continues the trend of refined aesthetics with a squared-off titanium frame and Gorilla Glass Armor 2. The Gorilla Glass Armor 2 on the Galaxy S25 Ultra is scratch resistant and it also provides anti-reflective glass ceramic cover the the smartphone. The design is both durable and elegant, with a slimmer and lighter build compared to its predecessors. The phone now features smoother, rounded corners, making it more comfortable to hold. The ride side of the smartphone houses the volume rockers and the power button. Apart from waking up the smartphone, the users can also use the power button to activate Google Gemini. The bottom part of the smartphone houses the USB Type C charging case, the slot for S Pen and the SIM card tray. The front is dominated by a 6.9-inch AMOLED display and the rear of the smartphone houses the quad-camera setup placed neatly in the top right corner. The smartphone also comes with IP68 rating which makes it resistant to dust and water. The overall build of Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra exudes sophistication, maintaining its status as a flagship device.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra sports a 6.9-inch Quad HD+ Infinity-O-Edge AMOLED display. The display on the smartphone offers a variable refresh rate of up to 120Hz. The screen is protected with a coating of Corning Gorilla Armor 2 glass which makes it resistant to scratches. We really liked the display on the flagship Samsung smartphone. It offers a crisp resolution, smooth 120Hz adaptive refresh rate, and enhanced Vision Booster for vivid outdoor viewing. Samsung has further enhanced brightness levels, making it easy to view even under harsh sunlight. The colour accuracy and HDR performance ensure vibrant visuals, whether you're gaming or streaming videos.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is powered by Android‚Äôs most powerful and advanced chipset ‚Äì Snapdragon 8 Elite. The smartphone comes in three variants ‚Äì 12GB+256GB, 12GB+512GB and 12GB + 1TB. The smartphone performed well during our initial testing and we didn‚Äôt face any lag. We had a smooth experience during multitasking and gaming. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is backed by a 5,000 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support. The smartphone also supports Qi wireless charging. Samsung claims that the smartphone can charge from 0to 65% in just 30 minutes. However, we are yet to test this functionality and the battery backup of the smartphone. The dual SIM smartphone comes equipped with an in- display fingerprint sensor and sports a quad rear camera setup.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra runs Android 15 operating system topped with the company's own layer of One UI 7. Samsung has also confirmed that the Galaxy S25 Ultra will get seven years of OS and security updates. Coming to One UI 7, the AI integration in One UI 7 feels more intuitive, with features like natural language search and context-aware multitasking. The AI features of the OS come with a significant new look, based on a new notification system that streamlines communication with easy access from the device's lock screen. It includes Now Bar, which highlights relevant activities across various features like Interpreter, Music, Recording, Stopwatch and more. One UI 7 also reduces visual clutter and offers a simplified homescreen, redesigned One UI widgets, and lock screen which enhances the user experience. We will talk more about the software in our detailed review of the smartphone.Same as its predecessor, the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra also sports a quad rear camera setup. The rear camera consists of 200MP main camera with f/1.7 aperture, 50MP ultra wide sensor with f/1.9 aperture, 10MP telephoto lens with 3x optical zoom and f/2.4 aperture and 50MP periscope telephoto lens for 5x optical zoom and f/3.4 aperture. Front houses a 12MP selfie camera with f/2.2 aperture. The camera delivered some really impressive results during our initial testing. The primary sensor on the Galaxy S25 Ultra manages to capture incredible detail and dynamic range. The AI enhancements bring sharper portraits and more accurate colour reproduction. Features like depth-of-field control and Galaxy Log enhance creative possibilities and help users do much more with the camera. Also, the redesigned camera UX allows more intuitive control over advanced settings. Camera buttons, controls, and modes have been reorganised to make it easier to find the features you need and to give you a clearer preview of the picture you‚Äôre taking or the video you're recording. For the detailed camera analysis, you will have to wait for our detailed review.Overall, the Galaxy S25 Ultra feels like a refined iteration of an already impressive formula. Its snappier UI, AI enhancements, and polished design make it a top contender in the flagship smartphone segment. The smartphone offers a sleek design and all the high-end and powerful specifications. But will that be enough? Wait for our detailed review to find out more.
Article Summary: Samsung launched its most expensive Galaxy S-series smartphone ‚Äì Galaxy S25 Ultra at its first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025 in San Jose, US. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 1,29,999 and it packs in a lot of features and looks like a compelling buy. With its sleek design, powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, and top-tier camera capabilities, the S25Ultra is designed to impress the consumers.
